The majority of errors are made in the NOMINALcategory.forms both Poon and Domingos (2008) (an unsupervised Markov Logic Network system which uses explicit constraints) and Finkel and Manning (2008) (a supervised system which uses ILP inference to reconcile the predictions of a pairwise classifier) on all comparable measures
clean_text: On the MUC6-TEST dataset, our system outperforms both Poon and Domingos (2008) (an unsupervised Markov Logic Network system which uses explicit constraints) and Finkel and Manning (2008) (a supervised system which uses ILP inference to reconcile the predictions of a pairwise classifier) on all comparable measures.

clean_text: Our formulation is equivalent to the one suggested by Finkel and Manning (2008) in a coreference resolution task.

raw_text: As another example, Denis and Baldridge (2007) and Finkel and Manning (2008) perform joint inference for anaphoricity determination and co reference resolution, by using Integer Linear Programming (ILP) to enforce the consistency between the output of the anaphoricity classifier and that of the co reference classifier. While this ILP approach and Ng? s (2004 )approach to improving the output of an anaphoricityclassifier both result in increased co reference performance, they have complementary strengths and weaknesses
clean_text: As another example, Denis and Baldridge (2007) and Finkel and Manning (2008) perform joint inference for anaphoricity determination and coreference resolution, by using Integer Linear Programming (ILP) to enforce the consistency between the output of the anaphoricity classifier and that of the coreference classifier.

raw_text: Second, we compare our cut-based approach with the five aforementioned approaches to anaphoricity determination (namely, Ngand Cardie (2002a), Ng (2004), Luo (2007), Denis and Baldridge (2007), and Finkel and Manning (2008)) in terms of their effectiveness in improving a learning-based co reference system
clean_text: Second, we compare our cut-based approach with the five aforementioned approaches to anaphoricity determination (namely, Ng and Cardie (2002a), Ng (2004), Luo (2007), Denis and Baldridge (2007), and Finkel and Manning (2008)) in terms of their effectiveness in improving a learning-based coreference system.

raw_text: It is worth noting, in particular, that Luo (2007), Denis and Baldridge (2007), and Finkel and Manning (2008) evaluate their approaches on true mentions extracted from the answer keys
clean_text: It is worth noting, in particular, that Luo (2007), Denis and Baldridge (2007), and Finkel and Manning (2008) evaluate their approaches on true mentions extracted from the answer keys.

raw_text: 3.5 Finkel and Manning (2008)
Duplicated Finkel and Manning (2008) baseline

Examples include (Finkel and Manning, 2008), using VI, Rand index and clustering F-score for evaluating co refer ence resolution; (Headden et al, 2008), using VI, V, greedy 1-to-1 and many-to-1 mapping for evaluating unsupervised POS induction; (Walker and Ringger, 2008), using clustering F-score, the adjusted Rand index, V, VI and Q2 for document clustering; and (Reichart and Rappoport, 2008), using greedy 1-to 1 and many-to-1 mappings for evaluating labeled parse tree induction. Schulte im Walde (2003) used clustering to induce semantic verb classes and extensively dis cussed non-IT based clustering evaluation measures. Pfitzner et al (2008) presented a comparison of clustering evaluation measures (IT based and others)
clean_text: Examples include (Finkel and Manning, 2008), using VI, Rand index and clustering F-score for evaluating coreference resolution.

raw_text: Recently Finkel and Manning (2008) show that the optimal ILP solution outperforms the first and best-link methods
clean_text: Recently Finkel and Manning (2008) show that the optimal ILP solution outperforms the first and best-link methods.

raw_text: Extending Denis and Baldridge (2007) and Finkel and Manning (2008)? s work, we exploit loose transitivity constraints on co reference pairs
clean_text: Extending Denis and Baldridge (2007) and Finkel and Manning (2008)'s work, we exploit loose transitivity constraints on coreference pairs.

raw_text: Extending (Denis and Baldridge, 2007) and (Finkel and Manning,2008)? s work, we introduce a loose selection strategy for transitivity constraints, attempting to overcome huge computation complexity brought by transitivity closure constraints

raw_text: Last, we note that transitive relations have been explored in adjacent fields such as Temporal Information Extraction (Ling and Weld, 2010), Ontology Induction (Poon and Domingos, 2010), and Co reference Resolution (Finkel and Manning, 2008)
clean_text: Last, we note that transitive relations have been explored in adjacent fields such as Temporal Information Extraction (Ling and Weld, 2010), Ontology Induction (Poon and Domingos, 2010), and Coreference Resolution (Finkel and Manning, 2008).

raw_text: Transitivity was also used as an in formation source in other fields of NLP: TaxonomyInduction (Snow et al, 2006), Co-reference Resolution (Finkel and Manning, 2008), Temporal Information Extraction (Ling and Weld, 2010), and Unsupervised Ontology Induction (Poon and Domin gos, 2010)
